message.content:
Here is a sample meal plan for the week that takes into account your dietary restrictions:

Monday:
- Breakfast: Oatmeal with fresh berries and a drizzle of maple syrup.
- Lunch: Quinoa salad with chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and olive oil dressing.
- Dinner: Grilled chicken breast with steamed broccoli and sweet potato mash.

Tuesday:
- Breakfast: Smoothie made with banana, spinach, and coconut milk.
- Lunch: Veggie stir fry with tofu, bell peppers, onions, and brown rice.
- Dinner: Baked salmon with asparagus and a side of quinoa.

Wednesday:
- Breakfast: Chia seed pudding with coconut milk and fresh fruit.
- Lunch: Lentil soup topped with fresh herbs and served with a side salad.
- Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers filled with quinoa, tomatoes, onions, and spices.

Thursday:
- Breakfast: Avocado toast on gluten-free bread with sliced tomatoes and a sprinkle of black pepper.
- Lunch: Kale salad with chopped apple, walnuts (substitute for almonds/pistachios/cashews), and a lemon vinaigrette dressing.
- Dinner: Tofu stir fry with mushrooms, zucchini, carrots, and brown rice.

Friday:
- Breakfast: Green smoothie bowl made with spinach, banana, coconut milk, topped with fresh fruit and chia seeds.
- Lunch: Grilled portobello mushroom sandwich on gluten-free bread with lettuce, tomato, and vegan mayo.
- Dinner: Vegan lasagna made with layers of pasta sheets, tomato sauce, and cashew ricotta (replace traditional ricotta).

Saturday:
- Breakfast: Scrambled tofu with vegetables, served with gluten-free toast and avocado.
- Lunch: Mediterranean quinoa bowl with chickpeas, olives, feta cheese (substitute for a dairy-free alternative like violife), and tahini dressing.
- Dinner: Baked tilapia with lemon and herbs served with roasted potatoes and asparagus.

Sunday:
- Breakfast: Vegan pancakes made with oat flour, banana, and coconut milk topped with fresh fruit and maple syrup.
- Lunch: Spicy Thai noodles with bell peppers, carrots, and a lime-based sauce.
- Dinner: Stuffed bell pepper soup made with tomatoes, chickpeas, quinoa, and green bell peppers.

Remember to stay hydrated throughout the day by drinking plenty of water and herbal tea. Enjoy!
